intro: Tromotriche pruinosa, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Tromotriche pruinosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
